# textHighlightStyle

**Type Property**

An attribute that adds a highlight color to the text to emphasize it.

## Declaration

```swift
static let textHighlightStyle: NSAttributedString.Key
```

## Discussion

The value of this attribute is an [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSAttributedString/TextHighlightStyle] structure. The default value of this attribute is `nil`, which does not add a highlight to the text.

A highlight adds a background color behind the text, and adjusts the color of the text itself to contrast appropriately. The [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSAttributedString/TextHighlightStyle/default] highlight style applies the system highlight color to your text. To apply a different color, add the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSAttributedString/Key/textHighlightColorScheme] attribute to your text in addition to this one. Use the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSAttributedString/Key/textHighlightColorScheme] key to specify which highlight color you want.

## Getting text attribute keys

- **cursor**: The cursor object.
- **link**: The link for the text.
- **markedClauseSegment**: The index of the marked clause segment.
- **replacementIndex**: The replacement position associated with a format string specifier.
- **shadow**: The shadow of the text.
- **spellingState**: The spelling state of the text.
- **suggestionHighlight**: A highlight associated with a Spotlight suggestion.
- **textAlternatives**: The alternatives for the text.
- **textEffect**: An attribute that applies a text effect to the text.
- **textHighlightColorScheme**: The custom highlight color to apply to the text.
- **textItemTag**: The name of a custom tag associated with a text item.
- **toolTip**: The tooltip text.
